tweet: The @AppropsDems' new Labor-HHS-Education Approps bill offers crucial aid for vulnerable families, and adds funding for maternal health & public health programs that promote the well-being of our American families. I was proud to vote for this outstanding bill. pic.twitter.com/e5yCey3c0x

I chaired today's DHS @AppropsDems hearing on @FEMA funding, where I shared my strong concerns about the Trump Admin's steep cuts to critical #FEMA programs, and discussed FEMA's involvement in disaster recovery efforts from California to Puerto Rico:  https://bit.ly/2GSz158

Great news! I added a provision to the @AppropsDems' Legislative Branch bill to let the branch employ #DACA recipients. As DACA faces constant attacks from the Trump Admin, my language will help DACA recipients represent their communities in Washington. https://roybal-allard.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401576 …

I chaired today's #DHS Appropriations hearing, where I led the questioning of Acting @DHSgov Sec. Kevin McAleenan. I stressed to him that we must have fair, just, and humane solutions to our challenges at the border and in every part of DHS. @AppropsDems https://youtu.be/j3AhsEgQyyU

WATCH LIVE: I'm chairing the Homeland Security @AppropsDems hearing with @FEMA’s Acting Administrator. We'll be asking him about FEMA’s FY 2020 budget request, and the agency's disaster recovery efforts. Watch at  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_e_R0RtMA4w ….

Shocked and heartbroken to hear that my dear friend Ellen Tauscher has passed away. Ellen was a great congresswoman and a great Californian, a fearless fighter for the people of our state and our nation.  My thoughts are with her family today. https://www.rollcall.com/news/congress/ellen-tauscher-former-house-member-diplomat-dies-67 …

I'm chairing today's 9AM ET Homeland Security @AppropsDems hearing, where we'll be questioning Acting @DHSGov Sec. Kevin McAleenan about his department and its fiscal year 2020 budget request. Tune in https://twitter.com/AppropsDems/status/1123212003357745157 …

Greeted some amazing young people advocating on Capitol Hill for immigration policies that #KeepFamiliesTogether, including my Dream and Promise Act (#HR6) and legal status for parents of Dreamers & US citizens. Always glad to see America's children standing up for their beliefs! pic.twitter.com/v1ZxJoEWNk

I led fellow #DHS Appropriators in touring a @TSA technology testing site at National Airport today. (You can see a baggage-screening facility in the windows behind us.) Thanks to #TSA's Patricia Cogswell for showing us some of the tech her agency uses to keep travelers safe. pic.twitter.com/FEWEIYFAR9

On this last day of Passover, a gunman has attacked a California synagogue. I send my deepest sympathies to Congregation Chabad, and vow to keep fighting in Congress to end the twin scourges of gun violence and religious bigotry. https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/27/us/san-diego-synagogue/index.html …

This Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month, let's put an end to sexual assault, and ensure survivors are protected & heard. I urge my colleagues to pass my SAFE Act, so survivors will get the economic security they need to protect themselves. #SAAPM

Happy #ArborDay! My parents raised me to love LA's trees and green spaces -- here's a #FBF photo of us in #HollenbeckPark. Today, as your congresswoman, I'm fighting to revitalize the #LARiver so we can make our Southeast communities greener and healthier places to live. pic.twitter.com/Z4gNN8fmHe

As chairwoman of the Homeland Security Appropriations Subcommittee, I look forward to chairing next Tuesday's @AppropsDems hearing with Acting DHS Sec. McAleenan. Be sure to watch it at  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OEoS_bt9DRY …. https://twitter.com/AppropsDems/status/1121441751049306112 …

I'm proud to be the author of the STOP Underage Drinking Act, which supports efforts to curb underage alcohol use. This April, during #AlcoholAwarenessMonth, I hope you'll visit  http://samhsa.gov/underage-drinking/parent-resources … for tips on talking to your children about the dangers of alcohol.

Adding a citizenship question to #Census2020 will undercount #CA40 families, reduce our district's voice in government, and deprive us of the return of our own federal tax dollars. The Supreme Court should reject the question and support an accurate census count of everyone. https://twitter.com/HispanicCaucus/status/1120461025717911552 …

This #EarthDay, let's remember that our environment is fragile and in dire need of protection. We must ensure a livable Earth for our children & grandchildren. As your congresswoman, I'll keep fighting for policies to combat climate change, and to clean our air, water, and land.

As people around the world celebrate Easter today, we keep in our hearts the victims of the shocking terror attacks on churches and other sites in Sri Lanka. Everyone should be able to live their life and practice their faith in peace and safety.
To our Jewish community, I wish you a #HappyPassover! #ChagSameach

Congress needs the full unredacted Mueller Report to conduct its legislative & oversight duties. Based on past investigations, DOJ has no reason to withold it. We can't rely on AG Barr & the White House's cherry-picked analysis to interpret this critical report for all Americans.

This National Minority Health Month, let's recommit to ending all health disparities. As Labor-HHS @AppropsDems Vice Chair, past #HEAA author, & @HispanicCaucus Health Care Task Force member, I want an America where your health is not determined by your race or ethnicity. #NMHM19

Appalling: The White House tried using migrant families and children as pawns in a bizarre revenge plot against CA communities. The Trump Admin should stop these games, and instead join us to fix our broken immigration system and ensure just & decent treatment for every migrant. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1116683854344019970 …

I'm thrilled to announce the entries in the 2019 Lucille Roybal-Allard Student Art Competition are on public display in the lobby of 500 Citadel Drive at #Commerce's @Citadel_Outlets. Come see this amazing #CA40 student artwork Mondays through Saturdays, 8AM-7PM, through May 2. pic.twitter.com/qgyqAUG8DJ

Glad to have Gov. Newsom's support for #HR6, my #DreamAndPromise Act! Our state & nation are blessed by the contributions of our #Dreamers and our TPS/DED recipients. HR 6 lets them stay in America, keep strengthening our society, & pursue citizenship. @CAgovernor @GovPressOffice

As chairwoman of the Homeland Security Appropriations Subcommittee, I was glad to welcome several of my House colleagues to present their DHS funding priorities during our subcommittee's Member Day hearing today. pic.twitter.com/RzQIUdEl7X

Delighted to meet with San Juan’s dynamic mayor Carmen Yulín Cruz, and discuss the successes & challenges of Puerto Rico’s continued recovery from Hurricanes Maria & Irma. As DHS Approps Chairwoman, I’ll keep fighting for the aid needed to help our fellow Americans on the island. pic.twitter.com/4rhCdzZiCX

Continuing our congressional delegation to Puerto Rico today to assess the hurricane recovery efforts. Here we are getting perspectives from the Puente Blanco community in Cataño. pic.twitter.com/6s9rGVDE7s

I just voted to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act! Very pleased it includes parts of my SAFE Act, including unemployment insurance eligibility for those who lose their jobs due to being survivors of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault, or stalking. #VAWA19

At today's Labor-HHS @AppropsDems hearing, I spoke with @USDOL @SecretaryAcosta about our dire need to protect child agriculture workers by tightening enforcement gaps. I'll soon reintroduce my CARE Act to help get these young workers the protections they need. pic.twitter.com/GoSyE7ATdS

My thanks to #CoastGuard Capt. Adam Chamie as he concludes his tenure as the Coast Guard liaison to the House of Representatives! As chairwoman of the subcommittee that funds the @USCG, I was glad to make this House speech honoring Capt. Chamie for his selfless service. pic.twitter.com/uz5UZYKZYn

Did you know that the #IRS has an online #SmallBusiness and #SelfEmployed Tax Center? Visit  http://irs.gov/businesses/small-businesses-self-employed … and check out the site's resources for small business owners and entrepreneurs.

This #TaxSeason, be sure to visit  http://irs.gov/credits-deductions/individuals/earned-income-tax-credit/do-i-qualify-for-earned-income-tax-credit-eitc … to see if you qualify for the #EarnedIncomeTaxCredit, which helps many #WorkingFamilies and individuals keep more of what they earn. #EITC

Need help filing your #taxes? The #IRS VITA program offers free tax help to low- to moderate-income #taxpayers. Find a #VITA site near you at  http://irs.treasury.gov/freetaxprep , or read the attached flyers for more info. You can also Free File your taxes at  http://irs.gov/filing/free-file-do-your-federal-taxes-for-free …. pic.twitter.com/Pw32zprznO

A5: Climate change is a clear, undeniable, and immediate challenge for all of us. Our efforts to fight it should include input from communities impacted by climate change, as well as government leaders, climate experts, health officials, and environmentalists. #NPHWchat

A4: We must promote vaccinations for all diseases that have vaccines available. Vaccines are a public health triumph: They are safe & effective, and myths of harm from vaccines have been scientifically disproven. Learn where to get vaccinated at  https://www.vaccines.gov/getting/where . #NPHWchat

A1: As Public Health Caucus Co-Founder/Co-Chair, I promote the importance of #PublicHealth to my colleagues, & I co-lead the introduction of each year's #NationalPublicHealthWeek resolution.
